ExecutionSettings.description:
Execution control settings.

Note: Model-based GUI automation is resilient by design - workflows always
continue executing even if individual actions fail. There is no option to
stop workflow execution on action failure.
ExecutionSettings.title: ExecutionSettings

Pattern.description:
A single image variation with its search configuration.

Patterns represent different visual appearances of the same UI element
(e.g., normal, hover, clicked states). Images are referenced by ID
from the Library - the Library is the source of truth for image data.

imageId.description: ID of ImageAsset in library (library is source of truth)
imageId.title: Imageid

fixed.description: If true, pattern position is fixed on screen
fixed.title: Fixed

offsetX.description: Pixel offset for click position X
offsetX.title: Offsetx

offsetY.description: Pixel offset for click position Y
offsetY.title: Offsety

Pattern.title: Pattern

MultiPatternMode.description: How to search when StateImage has multiple patterns.
MultiPatternMode.title: MultiPatternMode

StateImage.description:
An image used to identify a state in visual automation.

StateImages can have multiple patterns representing visual variations
(e.g., button normal vs hover state). The image data itself is stored
in the ImageAsset library and referenced by ID.

id.description: Unique identifier for the state image
id.title: Id

patterns.description: Multiple patterns for visual variations (e.g., normal, hover, clicked)
patterns.title: Patterns

shared.description: If true, this image appears in multiple states
shared.title: Shared

source.description: How the image was created (upload, pattern-optimization, image-extraction)
source.title: Source

monitors.description: Monitor indices where this image should be searched
monitors.title: Monitors

ragMultiPatternMode.description: How to search when StateImage has >1 pattern

searchMode.description: Search mode for this image (default, rag, template)

StateImage.title: StateImage

CoordinateSystem.description:
Coordinate system identifier.

Always specify which coordinate system you're working with to avoid
confusion in multi-monitor setups.
CoordinateSystem.title: CoordinateSystem

Position.description: Position within a region using percentages (0.0-1.0).
Position.title: Position

PositionName.description: Named positions within a region (matches qontinui PositionName enum).
PositionName.title: PositionName

Region.description:
Rectangular region on screen.

Defines a rectangular area with position and dimensions.
Like Coordinates, can optionally specify the coordinate system.

Examples
--------
Simple region:
    >>> Region(x=100, y=100, width=200, height=150)

Monitor-relative region:
    >>> Region(
    ...     x=0, y=0, width=1920, height=1080,
    ...     system=CoordinateSystem.MONITOR_RELATIVE,
    ...     monitor_index=0
    ... )

system.description: Coordinate system. None defaults to SCREEN for backward compatibility.

monitor_index.description: Monitor index (required when system is MONITOR_RELATIVE)
monitor_index.title: Monitor Index

Region.title: Region

StateRegion.description:
A region associated with a state.

Regions can be used as search regions, interaction regions, or
general areas of interest within a state.

bounds.description: Bounding box (alternative to x, y, width, height)

referenceImageId.description: ID of StateImage for relative positioning
referenceImageId.title: Referenceimageid

isSearchRegion.description: If true, used as a search region for StateImages
isSearchRegion.title: Issearchregion

monitors.description: Monitor indices where this region should be checked
monitors.title: Monitors

StateRegion.title: StateRegion

Position.description: Position within a region using percentages (0.0-1.0).
Position.title: Position

PositionName.description: Named positions within a region (matches qontinui PositionName enum).
PositionName.title: PositionName

StateLocation.description:
A location (point) associated with a state.

Locations can be used as click targets, anchor points, or
reference positions within a state.

fixed.description: If true, location uses absolute coordinates
fixed.title: Fixed

anchor.description: If true, used as anchor point for relative positioning
anchor.title: Anchor

referenceImageId.description: ID of StateImage for relative positioning
referenceImageId.title: Referenceimageid

monitors.description: Monitor indices where this location should be checked
monitors.title: Monitors

StateLocation.title: StateLocation

StateString.description:
A string associated with a state for OCR, input, or verification.

Strings can be used for OCR verification, text input, or
expected text validation.

identifier.description: If true, used for OCR verification
identifier.title: Identifier

inputText.description: If true, used as text to be typed
inputText.title: Inputtext

expectedText.description: If true, used for validation/expected text
expectedText.title: Expectedtext

regexPattern.description: If true, value is a regex pattern
regexPattern.title: Regexpattern

monitors.description: Monitor indices where this string should be checked
monitors.title: Monitors

StateString.title: StateString

StatePosition.description: Position of a state node in the state machine graph.
StatePosition.title: StatePosition

Coordinate system identifier.

Always specify which coordinate system you're working with to avoid
confusion in multi-monitor setups.
CoordinateSystem.title: CoordinateSystem

State.description:
A state in the visual automation state machine.

States represent distinct UI screens or views that can be identified
by their visual elements (StateImages) and contain associated data
(regions, locations, strings).

position.description: Position in the state machine graph

isInitial.description: If true, this is an initial state
isInitial.title: Isinitial

isFinal.description: If true, this is a final state
isFinal.title: Isfinal

entryActions.description: Workflow IDs to run on state entry
entryActions.title: Entryactions

exitActions.description: Workflow IDs to run on state exit
exitActions.title: Exitactions

timeout.description: Timeout for state detection in milliseconds
timeout.title: Timeout

State.title: State

TransitionCondition.title: TransitionCondition

workflows.description: Workflow IDs to execute during transition
workflows.title: Workflows

priority.description: Priority for handling multiple valid transitions
priority.title: Priority

TransitionCondition.title: TransitionCondition

OutgoingTransition.description: Transition from one state to another.

workflows.description: Workflow IDs to execute during transition
workflows.title: Workflows

priority.description: Priority for handling multiple valid transitions
priority.title: Priority

staysVisible.description: If true, source state remains visible after transition
staysVisible.title: Staysvisible

priority.title: Priority

Connection.description: Connection from one action to another in graph format.
Connection.title: Connection

viewMode.description: Preferred visualization mode for the workflow editor
viewMode.title: Viewmode

Variables.description:
Multi-scope variables for workflow execution.

Scopes:
    - local: Scoped to current workflow execution
    - process: Shared across process executions
    - global_vars: Shared globally across all workflows
Variables.title: Variables

WorkflowSettings.description:
Workflow-level settings.

These settings apply to the entire workflow execution.

Note: Model-based GUI automation is resilient by design - workflows always
continue executing even if individual actions fail. There is no option to
stop workflow execution on action failure.
WorkflowSettings.title: WorkflowSettings

Action.description:
Main action model - supports both graph and sequential formats.

Position is optional - required for graph format, not needed for sequential.
Config can be parsed into type-specific models using get_typed_config().
Action.title: Action

BaseActionSettings.description: Base settings that apply to all actions.
BaseActionSettings.title: BaseActionSettings

Connection.description: Connection from one action to another in graph format.
Connection.title: Connection

Connections.description:
Connections between actions in graph format.

Root structure: Dict[source_action_id, Dict[connection_type, List[List[Connection]]]]

Example:
    {
        "action1": {
            "main": [[{"action": "action2", "type": "main", "index": 0}]],
            "error": [[{"action": "action3", "type": "error", "index": 0}]]
        }
    }

Connection types:
    - main: Normal execution flow
    - error: Error handling flow
    - success: Success-specific flow
    - true/false: Conditional branches (IF action)
    - case_N: Switch case branches
Connections.title: Connections

WorkflowSettings.title: WorkflowSettings

WorkflowVisibility.description:
Workflow visibility levels for UI filtering.

- PUBLIC: Normal workflows visible in UI dropdowns and lists
- INTERNAL: Inline/helper workflows hidden from UI (but executable)
- SYSTEM: Framework-generated workflows for internal use
WorkflowVisibility.title: WorkflowVisibility

Workflow.description:
Complete workflow definition - graph format only.

All workflows use graph-based execution with connections and positioned actions.
Clean, modern structure without backward compatibility cruft.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this workflow does
description.title: Description

visibility.description: Workflow visibility level (public, internal, or system)

initialStateIds.description: Initial active states when workflow starts. Required for Main category workflows for model-based GUI automation.
initialStateIds.title: Initialstateids

Workflow.title: Workflow
